name: Ackee
description: A tropical fruit with creamy flesh and a slightly nutty flavor. Often used in Caribbean cuisine.

name: African Horned Cucumber
description: A spiky, orange fruit with a jelly-like green flesh and a mildly sweet and tart taste.

name: Apple
description: A crisp and sweet fruit with various colors, including red, green, and yellow. Often used in pies, salads, and as a snack.

name: Apricot
description: A small, orange fruit with a sweet and slightly tart flavor. Often eaten fresh or used in jams and desserts.

name: Avocado
description: A creamy, green fruit often used in salads, guacamole, and as a toast topping.

name: Açaí Berry
description: A small, purple fruit with a rich, earthy flavor. Often used in smoothie bowls and health drinks.

name: Banana
description: A yellow or green fruit with a creamy texture and a sweet flavor. A popular snack and smoothie ingredient.

name: Barberry
description: Small, tart red berries used in cooking, desserts, and as a garnish.

name: Bilberry
description: A small, blueberry-like fruit with a sweet and tangy flavor. Used in jams and desserts.

name: Bilimbi
description: A green, sour fruit commonly used in Southeast Asian cuisine and as a flavoring agent.

name: Black Sapote
description: A brown or green fruit with sweet, custard-like flesh. Known for its chocolate-like flavor.

name: Blackberry
description: A dark purple to black fruit with a sweet and slightly tart taste. Used in pies, jams, and desserts.

name: Blueberry
description: A small, round fruit with a sweet and tangy flavor. Commonly used in muffins, pancakes, and as a topping.

name: Boysenberry
description: A dark purple fruit with a sweet and tart flavor. Used in pies, jams, and as a topping.

name: Buddha's Hand
description: A yellow citrus fruit with multiple finger-like segments. Used as a fragrant citrus zest and decoration.

name: Cactus Pear
description: A fruit with prickly skin and sweet, juicy flesh. Eaten fresh and used in desserts.

name: Cainito
description: A fruit with purple or green skin and sweet, milky flesh. Eaten fresh.

name: Cantaloupe
description: A sweet and juicy orange fruit with a fragrant aroma. Often served fresh or as part of fruit salads.

name: Carambola
description: A tropical fruit with a star-like shape and a sweet, tangy flavor. Eaten fresh or used in salads.

name: Chayote
description: A green, wrinkled fruit with mild, crisp flesh. Used in salads, stir-fries, and soups.

name: Cherimoya
description: A green, heart-shaped fruit with creamy, sweet flesh. Known as the 'custard apple.'

name: Cherry
description: A small, round fruit with a sweet and tart flavor. Eaten fresh, used in pies, and as a garnish.

name: hocolate Pudding Fruit
description: A brown or green fruit with sweet, custard-like flesh. Known for its chocolate-like flavor.

name: Clementine
description: A small citrus fruit with a sweet and easy-to-peel skin. Eaten fresh as a snack.

name: Cloudberry
description: A small, orange fruit with a tart and sweet flavor. Often used in jams and desserts.

name: Coconut
description: A tropical fruit with a hard, brown shell and sweet, white flesh. Used in cooking, desserts, and coconut milk.

name: Cranberry
description: A small, red fruit with a tart taste. Commonly used in sauces, juices, and as a side dish.

name: Custard Apple
description: A tropical fruit with sweet, creamy flesh and a bumpy green skin.

name: Date
description: A sweet and chewy fruit often eaten dried. Used in desserts and as a natural sweetener.

name: Dragon Fruit
description: A visually striking fruit with pink or yellow skin and white or red flesh speckled with black seeds. Mild and sweet in flavor.

name: Durian
description: A large, spiky fruit known for its strong odor and custard-like flesh with a unique flavor. Considered a delicacy in some regions.

name: Elderberry
description: A dark purple fruit with a tart flavor. Used in jams, syrups, and as a supplement.

name: Feijoa
description: A green fruit with a sweet and slightly tangy flavor. Eaten fresh or used in desserts.

name: Feijoa
description: A green fruit with a sweet and slightly tangy flavor. Eaten fresh or used in desserts.

name: Fig
description: A pear-shaped fruit with sweet and chewy flesh. Eaten fresh, dried, or used in jams and desserts.

name: Goji Berry
description: A small, red fruit with a sweet and tangy taste. Often used in smoothies and health foods.

name: Gooseberry
description: A small, green fruit with a tart flavor. Used in pies, jams, and desserts.

name: Grape
description: Small, round fruit that comes in various colors, including red, green, and purple. Used to make wine, juices, and eaten fresh.

name: Grapefruit
description: A citrus fruit with a tangy and slightly bitter taste. Often eaten for breakfast or in salads.

name: Graviola
description: A tropical fruit with spiky green skin and sweet, white flesh. Known for its unique flavor.

name: Guanabana
description: A tropical fruit with sweet, white flesh and a spiky green skin. Known for its unique flavor.

name: Guava
description: A tropical fruit with green or yellow skin and sweet, pink or white flesh. Eaten fresh or used in beverages and desserts.

name: Honeydew Melon
description: A sweet and juicy melon with pale green flesh. Often eaten fresh or in fruit salads.

name: Jabuticaba
description: A dark purple fruit that grows directly on the trunk of the tree. Sweet and tart in flavor.

name: Jackfruit
description: A large, green fruit with sweet, yellow flesh. Used in savory dishes, desserts, and as a meat substitute.

name: Jujube
description: A small, red or yellow fruit with sweet, chewy flesh. Eaten fresh and used in desserts.

name: Kiwano
description: A spiky, orange fruit with a jelly-like green flesh and a mildly sweet and tart taste.

name: Kiwi
description: A small, green fruit with fuzzy brown skin and bright green flesh with black seeds. Sweet and tart in flavor.

name: Kumquat
description: A small citrus fruit with a sweet and tart flavor. Eaten fresh, often with the peel.

name: Kumquat
description: A small citrus fruit with a sweet and tart flavor. Eaten fresh, often with the peel.

name: Lemon
description: A yellow citrus fruit known for its sour taste. Used in cooking, beverages, and as a flavoring.

name: Lime
description: A green citrus fruit with a tart and zesty flavor. Used in cooking, cocktails, and garnishes.

name: Longan
description: A small, translucent fruit with sweet and juicy flesh. Similar in flavor to lychee.

name: Lychee
description: A small, round fruit with a rough, pinkish-red skin and sweet, translucent flesh. Popular in Asian cuisine.

name: Mamey Sapote
description: A tropical fruit with sweet, orange flesh and a unique flavor reminiscent of sweet potato.

name: Mango
description: A tropical fruit with sweet and juicy orange flesh. Eaten fresh, used in smoothies, and desserts.

name: Mangosteen
description: A tropical fruit with juicy, white flesh and a sweet and tangy flavor. Known as the 'queen of fruits.'

name: Mangosteen
description: A tropical fruit with juicy, white flesh and a sweet and tangy flavor. Known as the 'queen of fruits.'

name: Melon Pear
description: A fruit with pale yellow or purple-striped skin and sweet, juicy flesh. Eaten fresh.

name: Miracle Fruit
description: A small red berry that, when eaten, temporarily alters taste perception, making sour foods taste sweet.

name: Mulberry
description: A small, dark purple or red fruit with a sweet and slightly tart flavor. Eaten fresh or used in jams.

name: Nectarine
description: A smooth-skinned fruit with sweet and juicy flesh. Often eaten fresh or used in desserts.

name: Papaw
description: A tropical fruit with orange or yellow flesh and a sweet and custard-like flavor.

name: Papaya
description: A tropical fruit with orange flesh and sweet, musky flavor. Often eaten fresh or used in fruit salads.

name: Passion Fruit
description: A round or oval fruit with a tough outer rind and aromatic, seed-filled pulp with a sweet and tart flavor.

name: Passion Fruit
description: A round or oval fruit with a tough outer rind and aromatic, seed-filled pulp with a sweet and tart flavor.

name: Pawpaw
description: A tropical fruit with orange or yellow flesh and a sweet and custard-like flavor.

name: Peach
description: A fuzzy-skinned fruit with sweet, juicy flesh. Eaten fresh, used in pies, and as a flavoring.

name: Pear
description: A pear-shaped fruit with a sweet and slightly grainy texture. Eaten fresh and used in salads and desserts.

name: Pepino
description: A fruit with pale yellow or purple-striped skin and sweet, juicy flesh. Eaten fresh.

name: Persimmon
description: A fruit with orange or red skin and sweet, juicy flesh. Eaten fresh and used in desserts.

name: Persimmon
description: A fruit with orange or red skin and sweet, juicy flesh. Eaten fresh and used in desserts.

name: Pineapple
description: A tropical fruit with spiky skin and sweet, yellow flesh. Often used in fruit salads, desserts, and as a pizza topping.

name: Pitanga
description: A small, red or yellow fruit with a sweet and tart flavor. Often used in jams and beverages.

name: Plum
description: A small, round or oval fruit with sweet and juicy flesh. Eaten fresh, dried, and used in jams and desserts.

name: Pomegranate
description: A round fruit with a tough, outer rind and juicy, seed-filled interior. Known for its sweet-tart flavor.

name: Pomelo
description: A large citrus fruit with thick, green or yellow skin and sweet, slightly tangy flesh.

name: Prickly Pear
description: A fruit with prickly skin and sweet, juicy flesh. Eaten fresh and used in desserts.

name: Pummelo
description: A large citrus fruit with thick, green or yellow skin and sweet, slightly tangy flesh.

name: Rambutan
description: A hairy fruit with sweet, translucent flesh. Similar in flavor to lychee.

name: Raspberry
description: A small, red or black fruit with a sweet and slightly tart flavor. Used in desserts, jams, and as a garnish.

name: Red Currant
description: Small, red berries with a tart and slightly sweet flavor. Used in jams and desserts.

name: Salak
description: A reddish-brown fruit with scaly skin and sweet, tangy flesh. Often eaten fresh.

name: Sapodilla
description: A tropical fruit with grainy, sweet flesh and a flavor reminiscent of brown sugar and pear.

name: Snake Fruit
description: A reddish-brown fruit with scaly skin and sweet, tangy flesh. Often eaten fresh.

name: Soursop
description: A tropical fruit with spiky green skin and sweet, white flesh. Known for its unique flavor.

name: Star Apple
description: A fruit with purple or green skin and sweet, milky flesh. Eaten fresh.

name: Strawberry
description: A small, red fruit with a sweet and juicy flavor. Eaten fresh, used in desserts, and as a topping.

name: Sugar Apple
description: A tropical fruit with bumpy green skin and sweet, custard-like flesh.

name: Surinam Cherry
description: A small, red or yellow fruit with a sweet and tart flavor. Often used in jams and beverages.

name: Sweetsop
description: A tropical fruit with bumpy green skin and sweet, custard-like flesh.

name: Tamarillo
description: An egg-shaped fruit with a sweet and tangy flavor. Often eaten fresh or used in sauces.

name: Tamarind
description: A pod-like fruit with a sweet and sour taste. Used in cooking, sauces, and beverages.

name: Ugli Fruit
description: A citrus fruit with a wrinkled, greenish-yellow skin and sweet, tangy flesh.

name: Watermelon
description: A large, green fruit with sweet and juicy red or pink flesh. Often eaten fresh in slices.

name: White Currant
description: Small, pale yellow or white berries with a mild, sweet flavor. Used in desserts and jams.

name: White Sapote
description: A tropical fruit with creamy, sweet flesh and a flavor resembling custard and pear.

name: Wolfberry
description: A small, red fruit with a sweet and tangy taste. Often used in traditional Chinese medicine.

name: Yuzu
description: A small, aromatic citrus fruit with a tart and fragrant flavor. Used in cooking and as a garnish.
